Description: Flint and a family find themselves lost and wandering after encountering a musical bandit.

Episode: Ep 230 - The Duke Le May Story
Description: An escaped convict joins the train, but a shootout with a deputy causes trouble.

A young woman on her way to San Francisco becomes blinded in an accident.
Adams, Hawks and Wooster are having trouble getting over their San Francisco layover - but the appearance of a lovely Spanish lass brightens the prospects!
The comic antics of an Eastern 'greenhorn' threaten to go out of control. With Mickey Rooney.
A female newspaper reporter joins the train and starts talking to the women about voting!
A Spanish Basque joins the train so he can meet his three sons - but one of them has been murdered! With Leonard Nimoy.
Hollywood legend Bette Davis stars as a woman running a finishing school for young women - a dozen of them join the train.
A young woman accuses of Flint of perfidy - until she needs his help in rescuing her fiance!
An elderly river boat captain and his grandson joing the train before striking out on their own. With Ed Wynn.
A strong-willed woman holds Flint hostage and refuses permission to let the train pass through her land.
Flint encounters a man with five beautiful daughters - and a secret! With Andy Devine.
The Major finds a teenage runaway alone on the frontier - but the boy won't join the wagon train.
An Italian duke tries seducing the women on the wagon train - but he's running into trouble. With Elizabeth Montgomery.
During a Christmas Eve stopover, a young boy wanders out of camp in search of St. Nicholas.
Flint goes in search of a woman captured by the Indians.
The Major finds a badly injured woman on the trail - when she dies, he begins a manhunt.
Flint looks forward to a reunion with two old friends - but he finds them engaged in a vicious feud.
A beautiful widow teaches her son to hold the weak in contempt - one passenger tries to discover why.
Flint agrees to take care of dying man's son - even though the boy cannot be trusted.
A group of travelers must find the rendevous spot on their own when their guide dies while leading them to the train. With Jeff Morrow.
Flint finds himself accused of murder when he returns from trying to find fresh water for the train.

Episode: Ep 320 - The Ricky and Laura Bell Story
Description: A young family moving west is troubled when a new father is jealous of his infant son.
A hunted man risks capture as he attempts to visit a young man who once helped him.
A woman recently released from prison learns that the son she had to give up years earlier may be on the wagon train.
An English treasure hunter and a band of outlaws capture Flint to force him to become their guide across the desert. With Peter Lorre.
A dozen orphan boys join the train as they escape from a plan to place them under government care.
A con artist, found beaten and near dead along the trail, offers to trade his skills as a school teacher for passage west. With Dan Duryea.
A spoiled young lady decides to hide out along the trail, but is captured by outlaws - Flint to the rescue, but he may be sorry! With Leonard Nimoy.
A mountain man gets the train in trouble when he violates a 'no hunting' order from the local Indians.
Captured by a band of slave traders, Flint plots his escape with fellow prisoners.
A friendless drunkard is the main suspect in a murder case.
A friendless drunkard is set to be lynched for murder when a surprise witness steps forward.
An exotic countess urges Flint to abandon his planned route so she can make her way to Alaska - and riches!
A young crippled boy befriended by the Major becomes jealous when an orphan joins the train.

Episode: Ep 333 - The Dr. Swift Cloud Story
Description: Native American Swift Cloud returns west, trained as a doctor - but the immigrants don't trust him, and his own people brand him a traitor!
Rescued by Mojave Indians and brought to the wagon train, a man recognizes a former lover.
A stagecoach arrives at a frontier outpost with only two passengers - an infant girl and her dead mother.
The Major meets a man with a pet pig, a poke full of gold, and a plan for revenge!
A medicine show hustler joins the wagon train - with his pet lion!
Before leaving San Francisco to head east, Flint finds a book describing the adventures of an eastern 'greenhorn.' With Mickey Rooney.
The Major takes on a man who claims to be a distant cousin interested in working on the train. With Ken Curtis (Gunsmoke).
A snooty English Army doctor extols the virtues of the British Empire to anyone who will listen. With Charles Laughton.
Flint shoots a horse thief, who turns out to be a respected man and a local mayor - but suspicions arise.
The train is in the sights of a Mexican bandit when an Indian attack complicates the situation. With Lee Marvin.

Episode: Ep 406 - The Princess Of A Lost Tribe
Description: Flint falls into the hands of a descendant of Aztec ruler Montezuma - who plans to offer his own daughter as a sacrifice to the gods!
Major Adams takes on the mystery of why wagon trains never make it over a certain mountain pass.
Flint leads a group of Dakota settlers when torrential rains begin to scare the travelers. With Dan Duryea, James Drury (The Virginian).
A former Army doctor is unable to practice - the Major tells him a story that sets him straight. A legendary episode, directed by John Ford and featuring John Wayne, Ken Curtis, John Carradine.
A gunshot-wounded girl is saved by Flint, who investigates why a local tyrant wants her dead.
A widower and his young son join the train looking for a new wife/mother - but the woman they pick isn't exactly their type!
The wagon train finds itself stranded next to an impossible-to-cross river - while Indians threaten to attack!
A young preacher carries his new wife and life savings west to start a church when he befriends a known criminal.
A drifter hired to drive a family's wagon grows restless when a young boy tells him stories of heroic father. With Leslie Nielsen.
A sheriff, framed by gamblers, enlists Flint's help to escape a bounty hunter - but is the sheriff on the level? With Ernest Borgnine.
A widowed Quaker missionary, running a school for Indian children, finds herself in the middle of a war!
A retired Army captain and a group of orphan boys joins the train - but one man, who hates the military, causes trouble.
A man escapes an Indian attack and appeals to the wagon train for help.
The wives of the wagon train are being worn down by the constant rigors of the trek - and then the woman they all admire for her strength begins to crumble.
A young woman heading west to see her Army sergeant father learns he is near death - she takes a special route to find him. With Jay Silverheels (The Lone Ranger).

Episode: Ep 421 - The Odyssey Of Flint McCullough
Description: Flint encounters the survivors of an Indian attack - a baby, a bunch of kids and an elderly grandfather.
Major Adams falls in love with a woman who strongly resembles a lost love - but the woman is convinced he loves the missing lover, not her.
A woman and her son are rescued by the wagon train - when her husband shows up later, a group of men recognize him from the Civil War and plot revenge.
A kind woman makes up for her husband's rude behavior - but when horses and goods are stolen, the passengers feel tricked.
Flint returns to the wagon train camp to announce that their company has appointed Jud Benedict as their new wagonmaster. This isn't good news...
Bill Hawks is leading four wagons through to California when they are abruptly stopped by Tiburcio Mendez and his band of renegades, who demand they turn back.
When actress Nellie Jefferson joins the wagon train, her incessant demands for special treatment come to grate on Hale and Hawks, but Wooster is totally smitten with Nellie.
A blind man, his sister and young son meet up with the wagon train on the trail. They are trying to find a train that will let them travel to California. Saul is a qualified doctor and has h...
Polish immigrant Joe Muharich tries to befriend and hopefully straighten out Johnny Kamen, a brash young man who doesn't take well to anyone giving orders to him.
With his clever tall tales, old prospector Henry Shannon talks Charlie Wooster into coming with him to search for a gold mine. When Hawks finds out about this, he rides out after the two men...

The Santee family---Will, his mother, and his younger sister---join the wagon train under a false surname. They have been forced out of town after town because of a terrible thing a family member did.
An Army general announces he is taking over the wagon train and requiring all members to act as soldiers in helping him rescue a trapped cavalry garrison of 120 men who are otherwise likely ...
Flint goes to visit Elanor Culhane, an old flame of his who had been married to a notorious gunman.
Bill Hawks helps an Italian immigrant retrieve his village's beloved chalice when it is stolen by a couple of drifters.
After losing one of her children in an accident, a woman is bitter with the wagon train and plans to turn back east, while her husband wishes to continue west.
Flint comes across four survivors of an Indian massacre, the two Ellison sisters and two Carder brothers.
When Charlie Wooster's cooking goes from awful to good grief, Hale demotes him and makes his Chinese assistant the train's chief cook.
A dying Spanish nobleman asks Flint to impersonate Don Alvarado to claim the inheritance for the rest of his family.

Episode: Ep 501 - The Captain Dan Brady Story
Description: Chris Hale faces a dilemma, he must hire Capt. Dan Brady as a trail scout or lose his government mail contract, or love Flint, his right-hand man.
Kitty Allbright is a nurse who joins the wagon train. She soon becomes concerned about the people's poor sanitation habits.
Flint is scouting and meets an all female wagon train. Maud is the wagonmistress and she cannot be convinced that it isn't safe for them to cross Indian country alone. Flint tries to convinc...
Selena Hartnell is a bounty hunter looking for a murderer on the run.
Hale rescues Clementine Jones after the citizens of Cinnebar throw her out of town as an undesirable.
Jenna Douglas appears to have been a victim of a scavenger attack and is adopted by the train. Shortly after she joins, other riders begin to have doubts about her story.
A deathbed wish, Flint's foster mother sends him to find her son Artie, who Flint has struggled to get along with. When Flint finds him, he's been questionably elected mayor.
Lord Bruce Saybrook, London millionaire, takes his family out west on a hunting trip hoping to repair his relationships. They learn more about each other than expected.

Episode: Ep 510 - The Lizabeth Ann Calhoun Story
Description: Lizabeth Ann Calhoun asks permission to join the train so she can avoid the advances of a young man she claims is in love with her.
Flint goes undercover to infiltrate an outlaw gang.
Bettina May leads three generations of her family across the plains. Members of the train become concerned with her over-bearing nature towards her family.
Charlie's life undergoes an epiphany when he finds an injured buffalo and the animal befriends him. He takes the buffalo, who he calls Clyde, as a pet.
A man finds a corpse that looks remarkably like himself. He takes on the persona of the dead man only to find he was a living legend of west and had made a lot of enemies along the way.
A young man is found wounded along the trail, after claiming to have been attacked by Indians and left for dead, but perhaps there is more to his story.
Duke is sent to guide back three wagons that fell behind the train, when he finds them however, he encounters resistance from three men with them.
An old con man tries to fleece the wagon train by posing as a preacher.
Flint finds a young boy who witnessed the murder of his father and cannot speak.
Jeff Hartfield becomes concerned when his sister Jenny begins dating Dallas who threatens to put him in an orphanage at journey's end.
A judge and his family join the wagon train. Judge Clay has a reputation for cleaning up frontier towns, but his fanatical attention doesn't always draw praise.
A young lieutenant on his first assignment must face an overbearing, murderous sergeant who is determined to kill two deserters in cold blood.
The wagon master encounters opposition when he calls a halt to the train due weather. One group needs to push on due to an inheritance in California.
Flint tries to stop a man who has been taking prisoners and forcing them into slave labor.
A teacher traveling with the wagon train encounters conflict when he become attracted to the daughter of a preacher who has just joined the train.

Episode: Ep 526 - The George B. Hanrahan Story
Description: Ousted medicine man predicts future of wagon train passenger. Is it a hoax or real?
Part of the wagon train splits off to attempt a crossing at dangerous swamp. On the way they hear stories from the local Indians of strange creatures living in the swamp.
Newlyweds who have joined the wagon train. It isn't long before problems arise when an old friend of Helen shows up.
Chris Hale is traveling to see his brother Levi, who's about to be released from prison.
Wagoners find Ben Morrell and his son very antisocial: the two can't even tolerate each other.
A local hero is declared dead after a payroll robbery.
A Frenchman arouses strong, and polarized, emotions among the wagoners: men distrust him, women adore him.
Flint happens to learn the whereabouts of a man he's been hunting for years---to kill.
Duke's resemblance to gambler Jason Carter makes him the target for a murderer's bullet.
Bill and Charlie help an old friend, John Turnbull, defend his reservation against local land sharks who look to initiate a range war.
Duke quits the wagon train to take up a position as Deputy Indian Agent on an Apache reservation under Hiram Winthrope.
Upon reaching Sacramento, a young wagonmen falls in love with an upper society lady from the train.
The wagon train comes across a devastated wagon party where they find Renaldo, a wounded member of the attacking comancheros who was left to die by his comrades.
Caroline Casteel, captured many years ago by Indians, is traded back to a man who brings her to join the wagon train.
Madam Sagittarius has a reputation as a con woman and is distrusted by the passengers, except for one, who begins a special relationship with her.
Wealthy merchant Martin Gatsby, a man with little compassion for the less able, wants the wagon train to keep rolling and demands that Hale leave an inexperienced rider behind.
John Augustus wins a game of cards with a Chinese merchant. His prize turns out to be a beautiful Chinese girl, which the rest of the train takes issue with.
In the midst of a dry spell and desperately in need of water, the wagon train stops at the only source of water for miles. But the owner demands an outrageous price.
Hawks, wounded and taken prisoner by the Indians, falls in love with one of his captors, Lisa Raincloud.
Hale finds a gravely wounded Army officer, The officer is delirious but before he dies he says things which, if true, could seriously tarnish the image of a national hero.
Simon Levy and Patrick McGowan both consider themselves unbeatable at checkers, and when each loses to the other over several games their pride is hurt.
A woman on the wagon train is kidnapped by Indians, who say they will only return her when the chief's seriously ill son is taken by the wagon train to a doctor and cured.
Kurt Davos is badly injured while trying to save Florence Hastings, who is trapped in a runaway wagon.
Patrick O'Shaughnessy has come to visit his daughter Eve, believing her to be a respectable married woman.
A Bible-quoting marshal joins the wagon train with his prisoner, a young bank robber whom he claims to be trying to reform.
A crusader against the consumption of alcohol joins the wagon train, and begins to fall in love with a winemaker.
The wagon train finds Sam Darland and a number of orphan boys in an old ghost town.
A sea captain traveling west is haunted by nightmares from his past.
When his wagon falls down a cliff, Davey Baxter's mother is killed, and his arm is crushed. The doctor is unavailable, so Chris Hale is the one forced to make the decision to amputate Davey'...
On his way to Fort David, wagon scout Duke Shannon rescues Sgt. Johnny Masters, a man caught between two worlds.
Hawks rides to the Kaylor ranch to buy horses for the wagon train. He finds that the owner John Kaylor has just died.

Episode: Ep 620 - The Hollister John Garrison Story
Description: Bitter and alcoholic Stevenson Drake develops a dislike for John Hollister, a fellow Southerner, when he learns he didn't fight for the Confederacy.
Duke and Charlie come across a sheriff and his female prisoner, Lily Legend, a childhood sweetheart of Duke's who the sheriff is escorting to be hanged for murder.
When children's dolls are found mutilated in her possession, passengers believe that Sara Proctor is either deranged or practicing witchcraft.
Duke Shannon stops over in the town of High Times, and almost right away gets into a fight with, and accidentally kills, one of the gunmen who are essentially holding the town hostage.
Hale deals with a mysterious bout of typhoid fever ravaging a family.
The four Hooper brothers are orphaned when their parents are killed in a wagon accident.
The Perez family is run out of their town because people believe their daughter Juana is a witch.
While scouting in Wyoming territory, Duke is forced by outlaw Tom Tuesday to act as his guide to an important rendezvous in Ruby City, Idaho.
Samuel MacIntosh picks farmer Hamish Browne to marry his daughter Heather, before the two have even met, and gets the young man to sign a contract.
Duke comes upon three women under attack by hostile Indians. They are saved by a man named Blane Wessels who appears on the scene.
Tom O'Neal and Ellen Howard want to get married, but their parents object, so Tom takes money from his father's savings and runs away with Ellen.
Duke and Charlie visit an Army fort to see Duke's friend Clarence Mullins, a minister who was also a lieutenant at the fort.
Hale is entrusted to deliver a box containing $8,000 to a bank. Young David Garner is determined to steal the box, and he stows along on the wagon train.
Bill Hawks travels to a desert town to visit an old friend, an Indian who has a ranch there.
Invalid cattle rancher Henry Ludlow is so determined that his daughter Judy not marry young Basque sheepherder Antone Rose that he sells his land and joins the wagon train to head west.
Duke Shannon goes to visit his ranch, Shannon's Glen, which he gave his friend Jim Whitlow a half interest in.
Bill meets young Barnaby West, who claims he is traveling west on foot to Sacramento to see his father, a famous frontiersman.
A woman and her son, taken by Comanche's over ten years ago, suddenly return to their town.
The wagon train pulls into Fort Pierce and tries to secure troops for an escort through Indian territory.
The vice-president of the Kansas and Pacific Railroad must determine whether to go around a mountain or lose men trying to tunnel through it.
Cooper Smith fights his way into a guarded compound to try to save his captured friends, who are prisoners of the Widow O'Rourke.

Episode: Ep 705 - The Robert Harrison Clarke Story
Description: Robert Harrison Clarke is a London news correspondent out to prove that thriller dime novels glorifying the Wild West are false.
Cooper Smith accompanies Grace Marshall to try to save her sister Myra from a life of degradation.
Barney is taken hostage by an outlaw, Sam Spicer , who, along with his partner, Reno Sutton, has just robbed the local bank.
Cooper Smith starts romancing Sam Pulaski's sister, Rose, and comes to supper one night and meets Sam, he realizes that he and Sam have met before, and under unpleasant circumstances.
Eli Bancroft and his family are run off of their farm burned because his pregnant wife is sick and the town fear contagion. He turns to desperate measures.
Kitty marries a man who she later finds out is already married.
Sandra was a Union spy being held in a Rebel prison when she coaxes a young soldier, Jefferson Smith, to let her escape along with her partner.
Duke Shannon is out scouting when he hears a shot and finds a small group of wagons lost.
While scouting for water crossing the desert, Coop finds a prospector, John Cain , who is half dead from exposure and thirst.
Cassie takes care of a sick woman on the train and money is stolen from that wagon.
Canaby's small wagon train, became more difficult to operate. He began imposing restrictions on his riders, until one day several go missing.
Michael Malone is hired by Cooper Smith to drive two women to California, a grandmother and her granddaughter.
Jed was one of three brothers who robbed a train of $100,000. One brother was killed during the robbery and the other disappeared in the West, while Jed went to jail. Once out, he searches f...
A pregnant women and her husband move west, but along the way she wishes to go back home and makes a rash move to turn the wagon train around.
Kate runs a freight line and is on her way to deliver gunpowder when she learns a wagon train led by her old friend, Chris Hale, will be passing by.
An old clock-maker, Grover is fired by his tyrant boss after 40 years on the job.
Duke Shannon had scouted Andrew Elliott's expedition to find a pass on the other side of the badlands in which Duke was the lone survivor.
A recent widow, Melanie Craig , is courted by four young men, including Duke Shannon.
Pearlie Garnet , a young, pretty girl comes west on the wagon train and is caught stealing.
The wagon train passes by a town where there have been several murders within the past few weeks, following an influx of new residents.
Bill Hawks and Duke Shannon encounter Duncan McIvor when returning to the wagon train from a scouting trip.
Ben Engel befriends a young thief, Harry Deal, and takes him and his wife, who is pregnant, under his wing. After the war they all head west.
Barnaby West and a couple of his friends play several pranks on people while Chris Hale is away from the train.
Coop escorts a young lady from the train to San Sabo where her uncle lives. They arrive in town in the midst of a renegade's uprising.
Link Cheney is a famous riverboat gambler and as he moves west, he gets into a high stakes game.
An aging trailblazer, Zebedee Titus, brings his beaver skins to trading post for his yearly supplies.
Riders say goodbye to friends made on the trip on their last night on the trail before reaching their destination.
Bob Stuart and his bride join the Chris Hale wagon train. When Coop sees Bob, he recognizes him as a man he has sworn vengeance against.
Coop and Barnaby set out to stalk buffalo with a group of hide hunters, one of whom delights in taunting Barnaby.
John Gillman is found wounded by Abigail, an orphan on the Hale wagon train.
Hawks and Barnaby escort a girl to Sam Race's tent city of honky-tonks and con games, but the girl is dismayed when she find that the man has hired her as a saloon girl.
Going to the aid of a stagecoach under fire, Coop finds a Bostonian lady (Dana Wynter) to be the only surviving passenger.
A dust-covered delirious Irishmen (Leslie Nieslen) stumbles into camp and falls unconscious; he's the leader of an emigrant band that's been victimized and sees no reason to trust Hale.
Coop finds an Indian girl, Alice Whitetree, who has fallen and hit her head in the woods. Coop brings her to the wagon train.

Episode: Ep 808 - The Those Who Stay Behind
Description: The train doesn't have enough room for all who want to join, including an ex-convict whose life has been threatened by his former partner.
Nancy Styles, a spoiled, headstrong daughter of the wagon train owner for which Chris Hale is wagon master, is determined to get to Denver to marry the man of her choice, against her father's wishes.
Coop's boyhood blood brother (Guy Stockwell), now blind, joins the wagon train seeking revenge.
Trouble strikes the wagon train when Coop is wounded, Hawks falls ill and a band of hostile Indians prepares to attack.
A little girl's cries are heard during the night, but Charlie is the only one to catch a glimpse of her before she vanishes.
Hector is an inventor but has no money to finance them.
After shooting Charlie, an outlaw gang whose members include two women force Coop to lead them to water.
Hale breaks up a scuffle between a gambler and his former sweetheart (Jeanette Nolan).
A woman traveler in the wagon train (Marta Kristen) has a premonition that Coop's life is in danger.
Charlie and Coop ride into a deserted town where it appears that everyone left in a big hurry.
Because the Indians are in awe of an old-timers' giant horse, a Clydesdale who is nineteen hands high and weighs three thousand pounds, the elderly man is able to pass safely through their h...
An expectant couple, already deep in debt, need cash for the wife's medical care.

Episode: Ep 820 - The Miss Mary Lee Mcintosh Story
Description: Refusing what she considers to be a ridiculous fee to join the wagon train, a willful spinster plans to follow along in her lone wagon.
A female ferryboat skipper (Cathy Lewis) gets a pleasant surprise when the train brings her two visitors, her sailor son (Robert Stanton) and his new bride.

Episode: Ep 822 - The Betsy Blee Smith Story
Description: While visiting an old girlfriend (Jennifer Billingsley), Coop finds he's been recruited to pose as the husband of the woman's twin sister.
Barnaby kills a masked bandit and is then guilt-stricken when he learns that his victim was a boy his own age.
Hawks refuses to turn an Indian girl over to Chief Crazy Bear, who wants to punish her for killing his son.
Coop tells Hawks the story about the famed Earp brothers and a lady who perished in the wreck of a stagecoach hauling a cargo of sliver.
Charlie talks about his younger days in Pierce's Bend, when he worked for a rugged, God-fearing trading post operator (Rory Calhoun).
Jess Harper rides into Laramie looking for a man but when he is met by a hail of bullets he heads for the country.
When a man who saved Jess's life in the past arrives riding with a female preacher, Jess tries to avoid him but to no avail.
The stage arrives after a female passenger shoots a Pawnee who is the son of Chief Yellow Knife.
Jess's brother-in-law, an Army deserter, shows up looking for help to reach Canada via the Lola Pass.
A letter takes Jess to a town where he finds his friend has been killed but he develops a new friendship with the sheriff who ultimately hires Jess as a deputy.
Jess volunteers to go undercover for the sheriff and Army to pose as a guide for an outlaw hoping to locate the money from an earlier robbery.
Captain Sam Prado is psychopath that finds himself at Sherman Ranch and Relay Station with a saddle bag full of stolen money and the law hot on his trail.
When Ed Caulder appears, everyone is worried as he is a hired killer who receives his targets via General Delivery at the Post Office.
The beautiful Laurel DeWalt looking for a real man leaves her husband. She finds Jess who once had an affair with her.
Whit Malone, an old army buddy of Slim Sherman's, shows up unexpectedly at the Sherman Ranch and Relay station supposedly to have a visit with Slim...
It's a case of murder and revenge when a friend of Jess Harper's is unjustly accused, tried, convicted and hung for the murder of Doc Webb and Sheriff Kiley.
Sioux renegades, armed better than the cavalry by unscrupulous traders, are raiding and killing over a large ares. The stage line is suffering and there seems no end in sight.
Anxious to help pay the bills at the financially-strapped station, Jonesy becomes the promoter for a traveling prizefighter whose bouts aren't always on the up-and-up.
Slim Sherman becomes a target of one man's vengeance when Ed Farrell sends a letter to the late Matthew Sherman vowing to kill him for what he did years ago.

Episode: Ep 15 - Night Of The Quiet Man
Description: The former marshal of Dodge City arrives in Laramie at the same time that Slim is seeing Jess Harper off on a cattle drive with the combined herds of several area ranches.
It's winter, the Sioux are at war, and the Wyoming Territory has become their battleground.
In need of some extra money, Slim and Jess take jobs as drovers on a cattle drive, and Jonesy tags along with them.
Jess Harper has been appointed deputy marshal to escort accused murderer Gabe Reynolds from Cheyenne to Laramie. The stage is ambushed by Manuel Ortega, brother of the woman that Gabe Reynol...
The aging but still beautiful Lily Langford, the toast of three continents, is on a tour of the west and her next stop is Laramie.
An ill wind blows in the Laramie basin and Sherman Ranch in its path. With an impending tornado, Slim, Jess, Andy and Jonesy are hard pressed to get the ranch ready for the storm.
Jack Slade is the new stage line superintendent and he's a hard, ruthless man. He especially wants Jess Harper fired one way or another which doesn't set well with Jess or Slim Sherman.
Mary and Del Layton are held up and murdered for their strong box of money but the murderer is interrupted by Mace Stringer and runs.
Jess Harper travels to Patterson Ranch for Slim Sherman and finds himself up to his gun belt in trouble.
Five years ago, Frank Buckley went to prison for killing Cameron Gault's son Jay. He's back in Laramie now, and there are those in town who don't want him back.
The Laramie bank has been robbed Vernon Kane and a popular deputy killed. Slim Sherman trails the bandit into the desert and catches up with him in the company of Deborah and Jack Farnum.
Billy Pardee unsuccessfully tries robbing Wells Fargo office killing deputy sheriff in the process. Pardee's partners try to break him out of jail, Sheriff Cory presses Slim into service a...
It's the sod-busters against the ranchers and the homesteaders have hired Gil Martin and his crew to protect them against cattlemen intent on driving them out of Laramie.
The cattle market is depressed which forces Slim Sherman and Jess Harper to hit the trail looking for a better place to sell cattle.
Jess Harper is on the run from the law after killing a U.S. marshal in Laramie when he meets up with Vern Jamieson on the trail.
Slim Sherman gets involved in a fracas with the surly Glen Bentley while rushing Jonesy into Laramie to see the doctor.
Deputy Marshal Jess Harper and the Marshal are on the trail of Frank Bannister and his gang for two weeks when Bannister turns the tables on them along the Santa Fe trail in New Mexico.
A beautiful woman tries to avoid her marshal husband for his own protection because a gang of robbers is planning on killing him over a robbery he foiled - thanks to her warning.

Episode: Ep 33 - The Track Of The Jackal
Description: Luke Wiley is a notorious, coward, bounty hunter dubbed "The Jackal" because he brings in his prisoners dead, and now he wants to take in a friend of Jess who is wanted for murder.
Slim Sherman is riding shotgun on $10K of stage line money he needs to deliver to Rockland City. One hold up is foiled but a second attempt by the stage driver results in the death of Jack Adams.
Outlaws rob the Laramie bank but one of them is shot and killed by the sheriff during the chase.
Jess Harper comes to Danver's Pass looking for Dan Preston and immediately runs afoul of Matt Jessup and his gang.
Money is a little tight at Sherman Ranch and Relay Station which forces Slim Sherman and Jess Harper to become mustangers to make ends meet.
The stage line is expanding and needs horses but they are competing with the Army for stock. Slim and Jess decide to buy stock from Sam Bronson in Colorado.
Vern Clark arrives at Sherman Ranch and Relay station with his new wife finds that he's now the new marshal in Laramie since the Torrey brothers have just killed Marshal Blanton.
Sam Jarrad is a bounty hunter turned sheriff of Willow, Colorado and Jess Harper has become a man with a price on his head for killing Blake Wilkie.
Slim Sherman arrives in Laramie to buy supplies and finds the town pretty much empty due to rumors of a gold strike in Cherry Creek.
Fran Ericson, a woman from Slim Sherman's past, arrives in Laramie with one agenda, to ruin the stage company that ruined her father.
When Ben Parkison's youngest son is accidentally shot and killed on Sherman land it revives a years old feud between the Parkisons and the Shermans.
It's Christmas at Sherman Ranch and Relay Station, but the Sioux are on the warpath.

Episode: Ep 45 - The Passing Of Kuba Smith
Description: Kuba Smith is an old outlaw on the run from a posse and a substantial price on his head. When he kills the sheriff chasing him, he concocts a devious plan to switch identities with the dead man.
Clay Jackson, a charming self-styled Robin Hood, has come to Laramie to ply his trade - robbing from the rich and befriending the poor.
Joe Cloud, a Native American, is murdered by Carl Vail while working for Slim Sherman. When Slim prefers charges of murder against Carl, it pits the rancher against the town and the Vail family.
Clint Wade comes to Sherman Ranch and Relay station to force Jess Harper to lead him to where Jess caught up to his brother Roy five years previous.
Slim Sherman and Jess Harper are in Jackson City to buy cattle from George Lake when he reneges on the deal, leaving Slim steaming mad and ready for a fight.
Troy McCanles has set her cap for Jess Harper and has shown up at the ranch to pickup where they left off in Texas, much to Slim Sherman's amusement.
Ben Yuma is badly wounded in a train robbery and badly needs a doctor. He and his gang have holed up in the caves near Laramie where he sends his brother for the doctor.
Marshal Jim Craig is escorting Gil Spanner to Cheyenne to testify against Chad Farrell, but Gil is anything but cooperative and Craig is now nursing broken ribs.
Slim Sherman stumbles upon murder victim Hap Matthews and ends up getting shot by the murderer and left to die. Jess Harper saves his partner and ends up trailing the suspect to the town of Rimrock.
Cory Lake is the half-heir to a large ranch that he wishes to give to his mother's Cheyenne people, much to the disgust of his uncle and cousins.
Slim Sherman is hired to take Professor Landfield into the badlands to hunt for gold. Slim doesn't know that the professor is really Morgan Bennett, member of the Plummer gang who's escaped ...
Harry Markle is trailed into Laramie by a bounty hunter and turned over to acting deputy sheriff Jess Harper for the night. Jess owes Markle his life when Markle cut him from a hangman's noo...
Fred Powers is down on his luck and on the run when he meets up with Jess Harper. Jess and Slim help out the stranger even after finding out he has a price on his head.
Army paymaster Billy Jacobs and his young wife Ellie steal a $30K army payroll. All the while Ellie conspires with a gambler to betray Billy and escape with the money.
Slim Sherman is on his way home when he is shanghaied to become Billy Pore, a convict to be delivered to the Tumbleweed Wagon that takes convicted men to prison.
Scotty and Jess are driving the stage on an alternative route when the stage is ambushed. Jess and the passengers are forced to walk through the desert without food or water.

Doc Longley is an old outlaw looking to live out his last years in peace where he grew up - Laramie. Someone in his gang doesn't want him to and frames him for the murder of the town's deputy sheriff.
Dixie Howard is on the run when he and his companion, Julie, stop in Laramie to pick up a supply of whiskey. Dixie is forced into a gunfight and he ends up killing one of the stage drivers.
The Sioux are raiding in the Laramie basin and making it dangerous for stage traffic to use the Laramie road. Slim suggests using the Old Laramie road until things settle down but the road n...
Slim Sherman is in town representing the stage line in a contract with Sheila Dawson, an outlaw's widow - and also a secret investigator for the stage company.
Slim Sherman and Jess Harper rescue a troupe of Japanese entertainers on their way east when their wagon breaks down near the ranch.
Slim Sherman and Jess Harper are in a bind. They need a housekeeper, fast, to help corral the energetic Mike Williams so that he can live at the ranch permanently.
Daisy Cooper and Jess Harper get more that they bargained for when Daisy takes Jess to the dentist in Cheyenne and he ends up deputized to escort prisoner Hobey Devon back to Laramie.
Joe Vance, the man accused of killing Ben Sanford's son is being transported on the stage. Ben and his other two sons are planning on intercepting the stage and taking Vance and give him the...
Jess Harper is riding shotgun on a stage carrying a $20K payroll, but he doesn't know that the coach has been sabotaged so that it will wreck.
Ex-convict John Cole shows up at Sherman Ranch with the wounded Marshal Briggs and stirs up old memories for Slim Sherman.
Jess Harper is on his way home to Laramie and gets more than he bargained for when he's forced to stop and rest his lame horse at Ma Tolliver's.
Slim Sherman and Daisy Cooper are visiting Laramie but soon become entangled in a murder mystery that may involve Slim's boss, Allen Winter.
When Jess Harper saves a young disabled Blackfoot boy from a scalp hunter, he involves himself, Slim Sherman, Daisy Cooper and Mike in a whole mess of trouble.
Col. John Barrington refuses to accept orders from Slim Sherman, civilian scout, and continues with an attack on an Indian village.
Jess Harper is acting deputy in Laramie while Mort Cory is in Denver when he catches Tom Wade, an ex-con claiming innocence, searching files in the sheriff's office.
Gil Martin has returned to Cheyenne after getting out of prison to see his girlfriend. Marshal Al Dawson, who doesn't like Martin and had warned him to stay away, shows up - and a violent st...
Jess Harper's temper gets him in trouble again when he's framed for the murder of a rancher who broke a contract to sell horses to Sherman Ranch.
The Cady brothers have vowed revenge against an Arapaho woman, Winona, who was acquitted of murdering their brother. Slim Sherman gets involved when he rescues Winona from certain death at t...
Jess Harper is on his way back to Laramie after negotiating a large sale of cattle when his horse is stolen. Left afoot, the angry cowboy trails both horse and thief to Dry Springs.
Slim has been chasing down and finally corners a cattle rustler. Slim is wounded during the shootout but still manages to capture the rustler - a beautiful girl named Jean Lavelle.
Billy Watkins is a troublemaking teenager who has arrived in Laramie to live with his uncle. He's fallen in with a couple of drifters and is now under their thumb.
On the run from a posse, Matt Grundy comes to Laramie with a silver tongue and bag full of explosives to win back his wife and daughter.
Slim is trailing a horse thief when he meets up with cattleman Mel Bishop and his men in full-blown range war with Jason Duncan and his gang.

Episode: Ep 84 - A Grave For Cully Brown
Description: Jess Harper is on his way back to Laramie after a cattle sale when he stops to help Cully Brown, who is caught up in a gun battle with bounty hunters.
The Catlin brothers are a trio of murderous outlaws on the run and headed to Laramie, which spells trouble for their step-brother Sandy, his wife Marcie, and acting sheriff Slim Sherman.
The Bank of Laramie is shipping $50K to Denver for redeposit and Jess Harper is riding shotgun on the stage. When the money is stolen, Jess ends up chasing the wounded thief into the hills.

Episode: Ep 87 - The Day Of The Savage
Description: Glen Colton arrives at the Sherman Ranch and Relay Station to wait for the arrival of fiancee on the stage, but he's got trouble on his heels in the form of a Sioux war party intent kidnapping him.
Ev Keleher is looking for Arney Jackson who he thinks poisoned his water hole and killed his cattle. When Jackson is found murdered, the sheriff arrests Keleher.
Slim, Jess and Sheriff Corey shoot down an outlaw, who turns out to be a teenager. When the townspeople learn that their sheriff has been shooting children, they think it's time to replace him.

Episode: Ep 90 - The Turn Of The Wheel
Description: Frank Mannus arrives in Laramie but his reputation got there first. Billy O'Neil remembers how Mannus treated his sister Abbey and intends to kill Mannus for it.
Lars Carlson has sent for a mail-order bride, but she doesn't show up. Dancehall girl Zoie Carter thinks marriage will make her respectable so she decides to take her place.
Slim, Daisy and Mike are on their way home when the encounter Kathy Frances, a little girl whose mother has fallen into a well. Slim is about to send Daisy for help when three robbers show up.
Mike is wounded when three outlaws rob the Laramie bank. The outlaws get away and Jess joins the posse to get a chance at revenge.
Jess is the bodyguard a Union Army hero, General George Barton, who is running for President.
Kitty McAllen is being courted by newcomer Vince Jackson, which angers Slim. Slim and Kitty had planned to be married.
Jess thought his sister had died four years ago until she shows up in Laramie to bury her outlaw husband.
Slim arrests Virg Walker but returning him to Laramie proves difficult. Along the way Slim encounters difficulties with his prisoner, a friendly prospector, and a girl in distress.
Jess gets injured while tracking rustlers and ends up face to face with one of the outlaws. Turns out the face is very familar.
A mountain boy and his girl come to the big city of Laramie to compete in a shooting contest. After the boy wins it is up to Slim to see if he can help the pair return home safely.
Outlaw Al Denning and his gang are being chased by a posse, so he starts leaving behind some gold eagle coins to tempt the pursuing lawmen into a payoff.
Slim is deputized to protect Stephen Collier, a murder suspect with a killer on his trail - and his lawyer, who's behaving very strangely.
Jess is escorting a young boy to his aunt in Colorado, but the boy is determined to break away and go see his father, a cold blooded, murderous outlaw leader.
When Dr. Samuel Mudd saves young Steve Prescott's life after a wagon accident, it sets off chain of events that pits Slim Sherman against an angry father who believes that Dr. Mudd maimed his son.
Jess Harper is spending the weekend in Laramie as deputy sheriff, but his quiet weekend is about to heat up and the results could get him and Johnny Hartley killed.
Slim heads to Riverton to discover who killed Marty Patterson and took the 3000 dollars he was carrying. Lee Christy was responsible for Patterson's death but a mysterious gambler took Patte...
Joe Morgan is suspected of robbery and murder, and when a posse tracks him into some rocks Slim breaks his collar bone. The following day, Jess encounters Joe and the two shoot it out.
Slim's friend Mike Douglas is searching for his daughter, Alicia. Jess knows her as a saloon girl with a bad reputation. When Douglas finds Alicia, she shoots him.
Jess is in Ironwood when he runs into an old friend, Chet Darby. Chet sets Jess up as a fall guy during a bank robbery and Jess gets sentenced to hang.
Stacy Bishop divorced Gil three years ago and is planning on re-marrying. Slim and Daisy go to the wedding and attempt to prevent Gil from interrupting the ceremony.
A former safecracker, Gandy Ross, is dealing with an outlaw who's trying to get him to return to his illegal profession.
While searching for robbers Slim is shot and left for dead. With snow coming in, it becomes a race against time for Jess to find Slim.
En route to a neighboring ranch Slim and Jess run into a family of anti-social Mustangers. Once they get to the ranch they discover that the ranchers have been hit by Comancheros.
Jess and the Stage Agent are robbed at the ranch and Slim sets off in pursuit. The only information Slim has about the thieves is that one was riding a big grey horse.
Five years ago Jess crippled Bob Blayne's gun hand when arresting him for robbery. Now Blayne's sons are out for revenge, and when Slim is beaten half to death all bets are off.
Slim's newest hand, Ben, finds a pair of Arapaho camped on Sherman land. Ben threatens the Diamo's pregnant wife and is killed when Diamo tries to defend her.
Herb Richards is an ex-gambler and occasional thief trying to go straight and locate his daughter. Richards' former partners show up and strong arm him into robbing the town bank.
Jess finds himself in trouble with an unattended mule packing gold. Involved with Jess are prospector Canby and his partners - from whom Canby stole the gold.
When the stage is robbed, Jess sets off in hot pursuit of the thieves. The thieves hide the strong box on the Halloran's property.
Jess finds the remains of a US Army wagon that disappeared during the war with $60K in gold. It was suspected that Matt Sherman was involved in helping the Confederates steal the gold.
Slim and Jess are losing cattle to a mysterious stranger who leaves a gold piece for each animal he steals.
Jess rides to warn two marshals bringing in a prisoner of an ambush. Unfortunately, Jess catches a bullet in the chest, and the nearest doctor is in Ironwood - a town controlled by the priso...
Sam Logan turns up on the doorstep of John Holbry, a former bounty-hunter-turned preacher. Sam is dying and asks that John claim the reward money in order to build a church.
Slim finds an injured kidnap victim in the woods. But while Mike rides for help, the kidnappers return to reclaim their pretty hostage.
Ruth Franklin, a saloon girl, foils a plan by three men to rob Slim. Afterward she persuades Slim to help her father, who plans to return the $50K he embezzled from a bank in Helena.
"The Sharpshooter" - Series Premiere! 1881: Lucas McCain and his young son Mark arrive in remote North Fork, New Mexico, looking to start a new life. Co-starring Dennis Hopper, script by Sam...
"Home Ranch" - Two hired hands of a wealthy cattleman, who has been using the ranch for grazing his cattle, demand that Lucas and Mark move out of their new home. Written by Sam Peckinpah.

Episode: Ep 3 - End Of A Young Gun
Description: "End Of A Young Gun" - Lucas is forced to give refuge to a young bank robber injured while saving Mark's life - the bandit sees a life better than the one he's been leading. With Michael Lan...
"The Marshal" - Micah Torrance, once famous lawman, stumbles drunkenly into North Fork and faces two brothers intent on killing him. With James Drury (The Virginian), Warren Oates, written a...
"The Brother-In-Law" - Johnny Gibb - Lucas's brother-in-law - comes to visit. While Mark idolizes his rodeo-riding uncle, Lucas discovers that Johnny is on the run from the law.
"Eight Hours To Die" - Judge Burton seeks revenge against those who hanged his boy - including Lucas, the man who arrested his son!
"Duel Of Honor" - When an Italian aristocrat arrives in North Fork, his strange attire attracts the attention of Groder, a town bully. Co-starring Jack Elam.
"The Safe Guard" - A gunman is hired as a guard at North Fork's first bank - but is he conspiring to join the town's first bank robbery? Co-starring Claude Akins.
"The Sister" - Mark introduces pretty Rebecca Snipe to his dad - and her two burly brothers think Lucas would make her fine husband! Featuring Dan Blocker ("Bonanza").
"New Orleans Menace" - Tiffauges, a wealthy and sadistic Frenchman who is used to getting whatever he wants, decides he wants the McCain ranch.
"The Apprentice Sheriff" - Dan Willard is filling in as temporary marshal of North Fork - and he's coming down hard on some Texas cowhands. With Robert Vaughn.
"The Angry Gun" - Lucas and Mark share a stagecoach with a peace officer and his prisoner, Johnny Cotton - but the badman escapes with Lucas's rifle, and the chase is on! With Vic Morrow.
"Young Englishman" - Lucas gets in trouble when he accuses the foreman of a neighboring ranch of rustling some of his cattle. Featuring James Coburn.
"The Gaucho" - The foreign ways of a fiery gaucho from Argentina and his family disturb the residents of North Fork.
"The Pet" - A stray horse adopted by the McCains bites young Mark - is the new pet infected with anthrax?
"The Sheridan Story" - Lucas hires ranch hand Frank Blandon, an angry ex-Confederate soldier - but when Union General Sheridan comes to North Fork, Lucas fears trouble.
"The Retired Gun" - A famous gunfighter, who has promised his wife that he would hang up his guns, settles in North Fork - where an outlaw gang tries to lure him back.
"The Photographer" - A traveling photographer is in North Fork making portraits when he's accused of murder - but Lucas has a plan to prove his innocence! With John Carradine.
"Shivaree" - The wedding celebration for two young runaways is disrupted by a drunken crowd - Lucas wades in!
"The Deadeye Kid" - Mark befriends Donnel O'Mahoney, a tough kid from Brooklyn, and hides him when the boy is accused of murder.
"The Indian" - U.S. Marshal Sam Buckhart - an full-blood Apache - comes to North Fork in search of Indians suspected of killing a Texas Ranger and his family, But what he discovers turns the...
"The Boarding House" - Exposure of the past life of a now-respectable woman is threatened when a shady gambler wants to turn her boarding house into a saloon. Directed by Sam Peckinpah.
"The Second Witness" - Lucas is in jeopardy when he agrees to testify in a murder case where the first witness was killed before he could testify - and the killer is still loose!
"The Trade" - Outlaw Sam Morley falls for a young woman with a serious illness, and asks Lucas to help him with a plan to fund her health care - but a cruel bounty hunter is also after the badman.
"One Went To Denver" - Lucas welcomes his old friend Tom Birch, who once saved his life, unaware that the man is now a bank robber on the run with his gang.
"The Deadly Wait" - Dan Nowry, released from Yuma prison, arrives in North Fork intent on getting even the man who sent him to jail: Marshal Torrance. Featuring Lee Van Cleef.
"The Wrong Man" - A corrupt lawman arrives in North Fork claiming the reward for shooting a badman on the run - but his real plan is murderously evil!
"The Challenge" - An escaped convict, eager to prove that jail hasn't dulled his quick-draw skills, holds up the general store in North Fork and takes Marshal Torrance hostage!
"The Hawk" - Young Mark is rescued by a stranger, and invites the man home - unaware that he is on the run from the law!
"Three-Legged Terror" - When a rambunctious teenager wrecks a schoolroom, Lucas asks the boy's reluctant uncle to pay for the damages. Co-starring Dennis Hopper.
"The Angry Man" - The McCains try to be tolerant of their embittered neighbor Abel MacDonald, but the situation turns dire when the man won't let his injured son receive medical help.
"The Woman" - An unfounded rumor causes North Fork's outspoken feminist schoolteacher to be attacked by a mob of angry townspeople.
"The Money Gun" - When his employer begins to suspect him of embezzlement, a bookkeeper hires a professional gunman to solve his problem. Written and directed by Sam Peckinpah.
"A Matter Of Faith" - A drought forces local cowhands to work railroad construction jobs, but rail bosses are afraid they will quit if an old man's claim to be a rainmaker is true.
"Blood Brothers" - Lucas brings a dying man to town and is surprised by Marshal Torrance's odd behavior toward the man. Then three men arrive and demand custody of the stranger.
"Stranger At Night" - Mark finds a murder victim and starts Lucas, his friend Artemus, and Marshal Torrance on a search for the killer.
"The Raid" - When renegade Native Americans wound Lucas and kidnap Mark, Marshal Torrance joins with Apache U.S. Marshal Sam Buckhart to form a rescue posse.
"Outlaw's Inheritance" - An infamous train robber dies and leaves his ill-gotten wealth to Lucas - now he must clear his name and reputation with the townspeople of North Fork!
"Boomerang" - Lucas adopts an orphaned boy and teaches him how to use a gun - now the boy is ready to kill the banker he blames for his father's death!
"The Mind Reader" - When a wealthy rancher is killed, a traveling "mind reader" is called upon to help identify the murderer. With John Carradine, Michael Landon. Final episode of Season 1.
"The Patsy" - Season 2 Premiere! A group of outlaws devise a plan to get rid of Lucas so that they can take over the town of North Fork.
"Bloodlines" - After Lucas kills a mountain man in a barroom brawl, his father arrives in North Fork determined to take revenge. WIth Denver Pyle, Warren Oates, Buddy Hackett.
"The Blowout" - A dying gunslinger wants to end his days peacefully in North Fork, but a gang of badmen have other ideas!
"Obiturary" - A newspaper story about Lucas's skill with his rifle attracts the attention of a gunslinger looking to boost his reputation.
"Tension" - Lucas refuses to let a newly widowed woman know the truth about her late husband's past. With Harry Dean Stanton.
"Eddie's Daughter" - After the daughter of the hotel clerk arrives in North Fork, two strangers threaten her life. With Gloria DeHaven - Oscar winner from "Titanic."
"Panic" - Town character Brett Conway blackmails Lucas with the knowledge that a young couple McCain rescued are suffering from yellow fever.
"Ordeal" - When their wagon breaks down, Mark and an injured Lucas are stranded in the desert.
"The Spiked Rifle" - Mark is kidnapped as he and his father try to protect banker Hamilton's gold.
"Letter Of The Law" - Lucas must make a life-or-death decision: the marshal is a hostage and the kidnappers threaten violence unless a notorious outlaw is released. With Vic Morrow.
"The Legacy" - Lucas tries to do a good deed for the old town drunk, but it backfires when the drunk's son believes he inherited the McCain ranch. With James Franciscus.
"The Baby Sitter" - A dance hall singer asks Lucas to care for her daughter in an effort to hide the baby from her self-righteous, bigoted father. Written and directed by Sam Peckinpah.
"The Coward" - Lucas becomes involved in a battle between an aspiring writer and a cocky, bragging trail boss.
"Surveyors" - Mark is distraught and runs away from home after Lucas has doubts about his claim to have heard of a plot to rob the bank.
"Day Of The Hunter" - A famous buffalo hunter tries to goad Lucas into a shooting match - but when McCain refuses, trouble ensues.
"Mail Order Groom" - When a stranger arrives to marry the town spinster, two brothers with their own plan try to discourage him with threats and a beating.
"A Case Of Identiity" - Mark finds himself in danger when two unscrupulous detectives, searching for a man's long-lost son, claim he's the boy.
"The Visitors" - Lucas is drawn to a young widow passing through town on her way to claim an inheritance - but others who covet it are trying to kill her.
"The Hero" - After a young stablehand kills a notorious gunslinger, he is baffled by the hostility of the townspeople about giving him the reward. Then the dead man's buddies show up. With R...
"The Horse Traders" - When a horse dealer transporting a prize stallion stops in North Fork, two saddle tramps use trickery to obtain it.
"The Spoiler" - An elderly couple moves to North Fork under an assumed name to hide the fact that they are the parents of a vicious killer. The plan backfires when the son shows up at their home.
"Heller" - After foiling a girl's attempt to rob the general store, Lucas finds that she and her brother are plotting the murder of their abusive stepfather.
"The Grasshopper" - A condemned killer being transported by train murders a lawman and takes Mark hostage.
"A Time For Singing" - Mark discovers that the new preacher and his wife are impostors planning a robbery.
"The Deserter" - Lucas and Marshall Torrance get into trouble with the Army when they try to help a wounded young soldier who deserted. With Harry Carey, Jr.
"The Vision" - After Mark contracts typhoid fever and has a vision of his dead mother, he no longer seems interested in getting well.
"The Lariat" - An old friend of Lucas's returns to town - in the company of a shady gambler - and is accused of cheating at cards.
"Smoke Screen" - Several men are vying for a rancher's daughter's affections, but when she is found dead, one of them becomes the prime suspect in her murder.
"Shotgun Man" - Shotgun-slinging John Beaumont, who Lucas sent to prison, returns to North Fork with vengeance on his mind!
"Sins Of The Father" - After shooting a man in self-defense, Andy Moon turns to Lucas for protection from his vengeful brothers.
"The Prodigal" - To keep his invalid mother happy, an outlaw forces Lucas and Mark to pretend that he is the owner of Lucas's ranch. With Warren Oates, Lee Van Cleef.
"The Fourflusher" - A sharecropper enters his colt in a horse race, hoping to win enough money to buy his farm from the owner, who has bet on Mark McCain's entry.
"The Jailbird" - When Lucas hires an ex-con as a ranch hand, the man becomes the prime suspect when a robbery and murder occur in the area.
"Meeting At Midnight" - Lucas helps his former Army captain, now an undercover federal agent, infiltrate a gang of bank robbers. With Claude Akins.
"Nora" - Lucas finds himself involved in murder when he gallantly steps to the aid of a beautiful woman. Featuring Julie Adams (star of "Creature From The Black Lagoon").
"Hangman" - An ex-convict is blamed for a brutal crime despite his claims of rehabilitation.
"Trail Of Hate" - Lucas is out for vengeance when Mark is used as a pawn in a bank robbery scheme.
"Woman From Hog Ridge" - Lucas shoots a horse thief who turns out to be a member of the Boyle clan - and now Ma Boyle is after him!
"Seven" - Seven condemned murderers escape from jail and take over the town of North Fork.
"The Pitchman" - When Mark finds gold on their property, a fast-talking salesman - who tried to sell Lucas a new lightning rod - offers instead to buy the ranch's mineral rights.
"Strange Town" - Lucas tracks an escaped prisoner to a town that turns out to be run by the gunman's brother - a man notorious for shooting people in the back! With Claude Akins.
"Baranca" - When an outlaw leader lures Marshall Torrance out of town, Lucas tries to stop him from lynching a local man who killed one of his gang.
"The Martinet" - A former army captain comes to North Fork to kill the man who shot down his son in a gunfight - Lucas McCain.
"Miss Milly" - A new store owner upsets the town by demanding that all credit accounts be paid off. With Warren Oates.
"Dead Cold Cash" - The widow of a bandit killed by Lucas plots a grotesque revenge.
"The Schoolmaster" - Mark and his friend become trapped in an old mine. Directed by Arthur Hiller.
"The Promoter" - Lucas and Mark attempt to reform a con-man.
"the Illustrator" - Lucas encourages a drunken artist charged with murder to use his talents to identify the true killer.
"The Silent Knife" - Lucas and Mark try to persuade a persecuted young mute to return stolen money.
"Miss Bertie" - A lively old lady arrives in town hot on the trail of a notorious bandit, hoping to claim a sizable reward for his capture! With Agnes Moorehead ("Bewitched").

Episode: Ep 91 - Six Years And A Day
Description: "Six Years And A Day" - A doctor seeks revenge on the man he blames for ruining his practice.
"Flowers By The Door" - Lucas unmasks a killer posing as a door-to-door seed salesman.
"Long Trek" - Lucas and Marshall Torrance run into trouble transporting a captured killer back to face trial.
"The Actress" - A deathbed request from an old friend sends Lucas to a neighboring town in search of the man's long-lost sweetheart. Co-written by series star Chuck Connors.
"Face Of Yesterday" - Lucas thinks he has seen a ghost when a young man, eerily similar to a man he killed in the Civil War, challenges him to a gunfight.
"The Wyoming Story" (Part 1) - Lucas agrees to take a job as a federal undercover agent and goes to Wyoming to investigate rumors of arms sales to renegade Native Americans.
"The Wyoming Story" (Part 2) - Mark heads for Wyoming to search for Lucas, who's on the trail of a gang illegally selling weapons.
"Closer Than A Brother" - Lucas looks for answers when recovering alcoholic lawman Micah Torrence turns in his badge and returns to the bottle.

Episode: Ep 99 - The Lost Treasure Of Canyon Town
Description: "The Lost Treasure Of Canyon Town" - In a ghost town, Lucas, Mark and Micah tangle with the Newman family and learn the secret of a lost gold mine.

Episode: Ep 100 - Dark Day At North Fork
Description: "Dark Day At North Fork" - Blinded in an explosion, Lucas fights despair as he prepares for a meeting with a gun-toting enemy.
"The Prisoner" - Two ex-Confederate officers seek revenge on Lucas, who served as a guard during their Civil War imprisonment.
"The Assault" - A salesman can't talk his way out of a false accusation. Directed by Ida Lupino.

Episode: Ep 103 - Short Rope For A Tall Man
Description: "Short Rope For A Tall Man" - Lucas, accused of horse theft, struggles to clear himself before a lynch mob gives him a necktie party!
"The Clarence Bibs Story" - A simple-minded janitor-turned-gunfighter doesn't realize his reputation hangs on one lucky shot-and a lot of gall! With Buddy Hackett, Lee Van Cleef.
"The Score Is Even" - Lucas tries to get help when he is shot after witnessing a murder.
"The Mescalaro Curse" - Lucas is marked for death - he was foreman of a jury that convicted an Apache man!
"Stopover" - Trouble brews when Lucas lets a stagecoach stuck in the snow stay at his place - a whiskey salesman and a gunfighter fall for the same pretty woman. With Adam West (TV's "Batman").
"The Lonesome Bride" - Two pranksters write away for a mail-order bride - and the woman arrives in North Fork looking for her new husband - Lucas McCain!
"Death Trap" - Lucas recognizes Dr. Simon Battle as an ex-gunslinger with whom he once traded shots - but now the doctor has a life-or-death decision to make. With James Drury ("The Virginia...
"The Queue" - A Chinese man and his son fight prejudice as they try to open a laundry in North Fork. Directed by James Clavell (Shogun).
"The Vaqueros" - While on a trip to Mexico to purchase a bull for their ranch, a bandit imprisons Lucas and Mark. WIth Martin Landau.
"First Wages" - Lucas tries to find out why Mark has taken a job as a stableboy - against his wishes.
"Sheer Terror" - Mark and Milly are held prisoner in her general store when two gunmen attempt a daring robbery.
"The Stand-In" - Lucas is taken hostage by two prison wagon drivers angered that he won't give them more whiskey.
"The Journey Back" - Mark goes to work for Will Temple, a badly scarred and very mysterious rancher.
"The Decision" - Corey Hazlett insists he's innocent of murder, despite Lucas's eyewitness testimony.
"Knight Errant" - Lucas tries to dissuade a latter-day knight from rushing into battle over a disputed chess match.
"Honest Abe" - Able Lincoln's claim that he's the Great Emancipator himself amuses everyone except Matt Yorty. With Royal Dano.
"The Long Goodbye" - Stubborn Grandpa Fogarty is Lucas's main roadblock as he tries to get young Woody Fogarty to attend school.
"The Shattered Idol" - The stage breaks down and Mark recognizes that passenger Clemens is Mark Twain - who quickly alienates the townspeople. With Kevin McCarthy, Jack Elam.
"Long Gun From Tucson" - Lucas tries to stop embittered John Holliver from venting his wrath on the people who expelled him from town years before.
"The High Country" - Lucas becomes the target of a vengeful mountaineer after he accidentally kills the man's partner. With James Coburn.
"A Friend In Need" - Mark finds himself the unwilling companion of gunman Carl Avery.
"Skull" - Lucas seeks an escape when he's captured by outlaws while seeking help for an injured Mark. With baseball Hall-Of-Famer Don Drysdale.
"The Princess" - The Queen-to-be of France hides out in North Fork while her brother recovers from the measles - but not before developing a crush on Lucas.
"Gunfire" - When an expected lawman doesn't arrive from Denver, gunfighters attempt to break a man out of the North Fork jail. Directed by Richard Donner (Superman-The Movie, Lethal Weapon).
"The Quiet Fear" - Lucas's old Army pal settles in North Fork with his deaf daughter, who attracts unwanted attention from a trail hand.
"Sporting Chance" - An Englishman arrives with a custom-made rifle-and a plan to kill Lucas.
"A Young Man's Fancy" - The pangs of first love are painful for Mark: the object of his affections has eyes for another.
"The Man From Salinas" - Is the stranger in town to collect his dead brother's body, or does he have other motives? With Robert Culp.
"Two Ounces Of Tin" - Gunslinger Tip Corey says he's the son of a man allegedly murdered by a mob in North Fork. Co-starring Sammy Davis, Jr.
"Deadly Image" - Lucas has double trouble: he's accused of murder by a man who could be his twin!
"The Debt" - Micah learns that the prisoner he's to escort to the gallows once saved his life. Directed by Richard Donner (Lethal Weapon).
"The Tinhorn" - Mark is shocked when he discovers that his father is a poker player - and may be addicted to gambling!
"None So Blind" - Mark befriends singer-banjoist Lafayette Bly, a blind man looking for the man who took his sight - Lucas McCain!
"Jealous Man" - A retired lawman's irrational jealousy regarding his wife threatens to not only destroy his marriage, but also makes him an easy target for a man who wants to see him dead.
"Guilty Conscience" - No one's more surprised than Micah when newcomer Leota Carraway claims the lawman is her long-lost husband and the father of her child! Directed by Richard Donner (Leth...
"Day Of Reckoning" - Lucas is torn by conflicting emotions when he meets the town's new preacher-a former outlaw he once vowed to kill! With Warren Oates.

Episode: Ep 139 - The Day The Town Slept
Description: "The Day The Town Slept" - The town of North Fork becomes a haven for outlaws when suave Ben Judson smooth-talks his way into the marshal's job. Directed by Richard Donner (Lethal Weapon).
"Milly's Brother" - A veteran returns with tales of heroism and the fate of Milly's brother in the Civil War - but Lucas has his doubts.
"Outlaw's Shoes" - A head wound wipes out Lucas's memory, leaving him with only one clue: he's wearing an outlaw's gun! Directed by Richard Donner (Lethal Weapon).
"The Executioner" - A former friend of the Lucas's, just released from jail, comes to the ranch to look for money he had hidden there long ago.
"Waste" (Part 1) Marshal Torrance, Lucas and Mark find themselves trapped by bad men in a Mexican ghost town. Screenplay by Robert Culp.
"Waste" (Part 2) The bandits holding Marshal Torrance in a ghost town relax their guard, enabling Lucas and Mark to grab the lawman and escape to the desert - but how can they get back to No...
"Lou Mallory" - Red-headed beauty Lou Mallory arrives in North Fork, and makes a splash while taking over the local hotel.
"Quiet Night, Deadly Night" - Lucas and others are stuck in the local hotel with an outlaw when a possible smallpox outbreak begins. With Ed Ames (Mingo on TV's "Daniel Boone").
"Death Never Rides Alone" - A hard-bitten gunslinger, looking to settle down, rides into North Fork - where trouble awaits. With Lee Van Cleef.
"I Take This Woman" - Lou Mallory looks for a way out when a stranger arrives in North Fork claiming her dying father promised she would marry him!
"The Assailants" - An assassination plot unfolds as four gunmen disguised as cavalrymen enter North Fork. Their target: Sen. Jim Borden. Their weapon: a Gatling gun!
"Mark's Rifle" - Sharpshooter Marty Blair tries to persuade Lucas to buy Mark a rifle.
"The Most Amazing Man" - Fast-draw gunman Wade Randall clains to be a deadly shot, but he's less than anxious to display his prowess. With Sammy Davis, Jr.
"Squeeze Play" - A speculator will stop at nothing - including murder - to grab Lucas's land.
"Gun Shy" - Mark blames himself for a friend's accidental death.
"The Anvil Chorus" - A blacksmith-turned-deputy sets the stage for trouble when he demands that all townspeople turn in their weapons.
"Conflict" - Lucas's self-confidence begins to slip away when he misses an easy shot at an attacking mountain lion.

Episode: Ep 156 - Incident At Line Shack Six
Description: "Incident At Line Shack Six" - A railroad gang boss accuses an Apache friend of Lucas's of murder.
"Suspicion" - Can a mild-mannered peddler really be a vicious murderer? With Kevin McCarthy.
"The Sidewinder" - A young boy is gunning for Lucas, who killed his father during an attempted robbery.
"The Sixteenth Cousin" - A Japanese nobleman riding the first train to arrive in North Fork seeks revenge when his servant is insulted by local bullies.
"Hostages To Fortune" - Lucas questions Mark's honesty when it looks like his son has joined up with rustlers. With Paul Mazursky.

Episode: Ep 161 - And The Devil Makes Five
Description: "And The Devil Makes Five" - A deadly snake crawls into Lucas's bed on a trip, and Mark must lure it away before it strikes.
"End Of The Hunt" - Lucas is thrown into jail to stop him from murdering an old enemy.
"The Bullet" - Lucas is baffled when the marshal of a neighboring town refuses to hold a gambler who just attempted murder.
"Requiem At Mission Springs" - Lucas begins a trek to find a cure for Mark, who is paralyzed after a bad fall.
"The Guest" - New arrival Mario Arsatti becomes very friendly with Lucas, but this turns out to be merely pleasure before business - he's been hired to kill Lucas!
"Old Man Running" - Lucas, who blames his wife's death on his father-in-law, refuses to help when the old man arrives in North Fork with trouble on his trail.
"Which Way'd They Go?" - Lucas helps out a neighboring town when its inept lawmen can't corral some troublesome badmen.
"Old Tony" - Mark and his girlfriend Laurie are taken prisoner when they trespass on an old hermit's land. The final episode!
